We appreciate the friendliness of everyone who works at Myriad and the attention to detail in the menu.  My favorites are the Cheesy Anson Mills Grits, the Deviled Eggs, the Goat Cheese and Chive Biscuits, oh and the Roasted Butternut Squash Soup ..... you get the point.  

Be seeing you soon Trish, 
Jenn & Nabil
author: JENN S.

description: I love this place. Ingredients are thoughtful and everything is cooked to perfection. The cocktails are really interesting. Wish I weren't such a lightweight so I could try more!! Can't wait to return.
author: vanessa e.

description: Decent food. Nothing impressive. Slow service at 8 on a Tuesday night. Pricey food. With so many other options I won't likely go back.
author: Mike M.

description: Service was excellent last night but food not so much. Perhaps an off night for the chef - we've had better on other evenings there.
author: David R.

description: Just had Brunch here and the food was super yummy.  My husband had the lamb sandwich and said it was amazing.  The deviled eggs were a must.  I had them make the pork dish with the egg and the flavor was so good.  Great staff also.  Dane who was our server and is the bartender was friendly and helpful.
author: ruby r.

description: We were in last night with a party of 6 and had a great time!  The service was perfect, everyone loved there food and the atmosphere was pleasent. We each had different meals from butternut squash soup, to the steak, and lamb sandwich and every one raved about what they had.  Oh and can't forget the dessert...amazing!
author: Cheryl L.

description: We went as a group of 5 and shared a number of appetizers and small/large plates. Everything looked so good, it was hard to choose - lots of options, including vegetarian dishes. All of the plates were wonderful and the service was excellent. We shared 2 desserts - the apple crisp and the pot de creme. Both were amazing and highly recommended. I cant wait to go back and try other plates!
author: Laura C.

description: This place has only been open two weeks and I have already been in twice! The deviled eggs, farm toast, house made pickles and crispy chicken sammies were delectable but I'm so glad we tried the burger, the market salad and the wedge on our return back - just delicious! And don't skip dessert! Butter-with-scotch pot de creme - need I say more? Yum!
author: Ananda H.

description: We really enjoyed this place. The best part of the meal was actually the server, who was super friendly, professional, and competent. The food was more like 4.75 stars, very good but not mind blowing. They seem to put burrata on everything, which I can definitely get with. We enjoyed a few different wines, didn't try the cocktails but they look tasty. Decor was comfortable too. I made a reservation for 6 and we were sat in a nook by the window. Very pleasant evening!
author: Steve E.

description: This is hands down, the worst customer service experience I ever had in San Francisco. We had a bunch of friends out of town visiting and was hoping to try this place based on the review on yelp. I would give them credit that they were understaffed, but the fact that other people were getting their drinks and food before us was ridiculous due to the large group we have and the fact that we were arrived an hour earlier than most of them. I felt beyond disrespected and had to come out of my 5 year yelp absence to write this review.
author: Denny L.

description: The Bartender and Waiter were both very friendly and helpful in selecting our meals, both of which were very good. The Kale salad was surprising good.
author: Steve S.

description: Start with the pickled veggies then get the Chicken Sammies, they are amazing. The spiced shrimp and bacalaitos were super good too. This place should be more packed.
author: Cameron P.

description: Wow, this was the most amazing food I'be had in awhile. I was solo and looking for a grass fed burger. This was perfection. And the side of baby kale still on the stalk, unique and wonderful!
author: Posey M.

description: This place is nothing short of amazing, and so worth the wait,the deviled eggs ...awesome,spiced shrimp & grits outstanding..... the lamb sandwhich a must try...desert; pot de creme' the best I've ever had. this place is a must do.....
author: Danny T.

description: Another very good entry in the mission, the food is fresh and tasty. No hard liquor, which I don't drink anyway. Reasonable prices, great food - this is another awesome example of the best of the mission.
author: Kurt R.

description: I had one of the better meals i have had in a while.  Super simple, but tasty.  The fried chx sliders and hamburger were fantastic.
author: Mac F.

description: This place is great, I would recommend to all my close friends, atmosphere is great, and food is  ammmaaaazing!!!!!! Come here won't regret it.
author: Allan P.

description: Great lunch here today. I had the Roast Lamb sandwich. My wife and daughter split a hamburger. Both were great. Highlights were the Deviled Eggs and Polenta Cake. Very friendly and helpful service. Nice surprise walk in.
author: Ron E.

description: All I can say is "WOW"! The service is spectacular. I am sitting here in their restaurant as we speak and I felt the need to really express my satisfaction with their service and great tasting food! I will definitely be bringing by my friends and family when they come to visit SF!
author: Mathew C.

description: On vacation from W. Hollywood, I wandered in after some local bar drinking and found a very pleasant, welcoming spot. At my affable and more-than-capable server Danny's suggestion, I ordered the pappardelle with pork cheeks, peas, kale, and mushrooms in brown sauce: Italian peasant comfort food at its best, in a more upscale setting. Grandma would be proud! Dessert begged to be ordered. Again at Danny's suggestion, I had the butter-with-scotch pot de creme for dessert. OMG!  Amazing, as are the homemade shortbread cookies that accompany. I'll be back.
author: A. J.

description: Came with a group of friends based on the glowing reviews and was a bit disappointed. The menu is all around the place - they are trying to piggy back on the gastropub trend and its lukewarm. It's good but not exceptional and a bit pricey for what you get. The service was attentive but felt a bit robotic.
author: Ruben K.

description: Omg! One of my new favorites spots! Everything I put in my mouth was delicious   A must is the bone marrow yum.
author: Ernesto Z.

description: This review is from my five-year old son:  their bathroom is really clean.  Their food is great.   The fried chicken sandwich is crispy.  The sparkling strawberry lemonade is very sweet.  The waiter/bartender is really nice.  I love the chips because they are spicy.  The room is really nice.
author: Bradley R.

description: Yum all around!  My husband and I tried out Myriad on date night.  Server was great  - nice, attentive, but great balance of giving us space to decide, chat and enjoy.  We had a hard time narrowing in on our order because there were so many great options.  Deviled Eggs, pickles were great - the chicken sammies are a must and the hangar steak was cooked perfectly.  I want to bathe myself in the pot-de-creme and my hubby raved about the crisp.  Nice wine suggestion by the server - I'll be seeking out bottles outside.  My experience exceeded my expectations - I'm eager to try brunch and will certainly be back for dinner again very soon.  Thanks for making my date night fantastic.
author: Sean L.

description: Amazing. Everything was delicious.
author: Jill T.

description: This place is amazing!  Been here twice and plan on going often. The food is amazing,  delicious,  and fresh with creative and beautiful presentation.   The staff is really friendly and down to earth,  while the atmosphere is comfortable and laid back.   The specialty cocktails are a must!   Also,  they have a nice selection of wines and beer.   I recommend this place to my friends and clients constantly:)
author: Jody K.

description: They have it down for service - our waiter was excellent. We were seated quickly.  The food was mostly very good. The deviled eggs were great, he chicken Sammie's came out hot, my papparedelle with pork cheeks was good with a very rich sauce. Thee market salad was good - could use just a bit more Pepito's, celery and asparagus to make it more interesting. My husband's burger which ordered medium rare came out well done and hard as a rock. He had to send it back. Overall, Myriad is a very pleasant place to hang with friends for dinner - it felt relaxed and the menu had a selection we enjoyed. Fun to have the different small and big plates to share or hoard for yourself!
author: Jenny B.

description: Went there last night and was pleasantly surprised by the amazing food and inviting atmosphere. Our server, Jennifer was informative, friendly, and fast. Try the Sand Bar drink. It's worth the trip alone.
author: Richard C.

description:
Let me start off by saying that I don't review places I have been, but this is a first and a must. A friend I recently visited in San Francisco mentioned Myriad Gastro Pub as one of the places I should try while I visited. She did not steer me wrong. Before I get to the food, let me say that Stephen ,the bartender, was awesome. I started off with the farm toast and it was delicious stat to my meal. The second meal I had was the bacalaitos. I highly recommend getting these. The third meal was the bone marrow. DO NOT pass up on this dish. Oh my god it was good. No, it was phenomenal. The last meal I had was the papardelli with pork cheeks. It was sooo good and the noodles with it were amazing. If you are around the Mission area, you need to go here. You won't regret it. From my understanding, it is a new restaurant and judging by the food, you might want to go before it becomes difficult to get in because that food was too good. 
I want to add that the atmosphere was comforting and the service was personal. Something I didn't find in the other restaurants I visited. I myself am a cook in Ohio, so I feel that I couldn't pass up on reviewing this newly started restaurant. Again, you won't be disappointed with your experience here.
author: James C.

description: Felt like the waiter was trying to upsell on everything.  Asked about a Pinot Gris which he said was 'bone dry'  it wasn't & was more fruity flavor.  Food was good.  Nothing to write home about.  We passed on dessert and coffee, had been there 1. 5 hours, were still finishing our wine - spent over $200 for 4 of us & the host comes over to ask us if we're going to be hanging out awhile.  Prefaces the question with 'i'm not trying to be rude but...."  But you are rude.  Any restaurant worth their salt never asks that.  And there were seats available if a party was waiting.  I don't think 1.5 hours is extremely long to indulge in wine, apps & entrees.  We will never, ever go back.
author: KEL C.

description: Amazing food and easily the best service I've had at any brunch spot.  Plenty of seating and none of the "communal seating" bullshit.  Also, for those also from NJ they have a Taylor ham, egg, and cheese sandwich which is really great.  This may be my new go-to restaurant in the mission.
author: Mackenzie B.

description: This place is so loud. It's a screaming match. If you are looking for a quiet place for some food and drinks. It's not the place to be.
author: Maria Z.

description:
I've had two amazing meals here. And I do mean AMAZING. Simple, elegant and straight forward but so very well done.
We started with the deviled eggs that were conversation stoppers. We shared a moment of silence as we both savored them. In other words, they gave us pause.

The staff was a delightful combination of knowledgeable, hospitable and fun- which was a blast. as well as easy and delightful!

The flank steak and the butter with scotch were my favorite.

Great place and totally worth the try.
author: Deagon W.

description:
Just what tha Mission needed a warm inviting restaurant with great food. The service is friendly and knowledgeable. Make sure you try one of the cocktails, Cubano yummie! Chef Trish's menu has something for everyone. I love the fried chicken sammies. The pork is also one of my favorites. Other items you must try, Jersey wedge, farm toast, shrimp & grits. Save room for dessert can't go wrong with any of them but I loved the Zeppole.
Love, love this place!
author: Ana L.

description: Incredible food, amazing service and all around excellent place to eat! The menu offers a variety of delicious options to chose from and you can't go wrong. My personal favorite was the roasted halibut with clams and for dessert the stone fruit and berry pecan crisp is to die for! Definitely recommend heading over to Myriad, you won't regret it!
author: Megan L.

description: Great space to hang with friends, DELICIOUS eats!  The grits are awmazing!! Great location!  Looking forward to brunch!
author: Nina G.

description: One of the best meals ever! The service was impeccable and Danny took great care of us. The farm toast was a perfect starter, the combination of flavors matched perfectly with the fermented wine based cocktail! Danny guided us seamlessly through an expansive cultural menu: from the south to the Mayan region and off to Italy for dessert! Do not miss the pot du creme for dessert! We even had the privilege of meeting the Chef Trish!! Amazing vision and execution!! Go now! Cent'Anni.
author: Kristyn F.

description: What a great place!  Loved the decor and ambience. Staff was very down to earth and helpful, felt like your neighborhood place. Being from New Jersey, I of course had to get the Taylor Ham sandwich and it was delicious!  Everyone enjoyed their meals thoroughly. We will be back as there are other thing that looked great to try. Thanks!
author: Maureen L.

description: Get the fried chicken samies. Yum. The drinks are NOT spirit forward. Popcorn snack was sprinkled the cheese and lime. Nice space and fabulous service.
author: flashegirl e.

description: The food is good and diverse, the service was outstanding. Loved the deviled eggs and Farm toast apps were good. I'd go back for sure.
author: Tom F.

description: Let me first start off by saying that the quality of food and the taste was pretty solid.. My issue is with the portion size. We ordered the bone barrow ($11) which came with one bone two pretty good size pieces of bread. The bone contains barely any marrow which was a totally bummer because what we could taste was pretty good. I would have been please if there were 2 pieces of bone that came with the order. We also ordered the spiced potato chips with the yogurt horseradish dip, these were really good, great flavor on both the chips and the yogurt dip! Lastly we ordered the chicken sliders ($11), this is where the majority of our issue lies.. These things (2) are small and when I say small I mean maybe a 50 cent piece size. Don't get me wrong, these were also very very tasty, great flavor on the slaw and the chicken was cooked just right with enough crunch from the fried breading.. I just think that if you're going to charge $11 and going to offer your customers that portion size, a minimum of 3 pieces should come with this order. Another bummer was they were out of the sangria we ordered and the dude who sat next to us (6 inches away) was speaking so loud that the people driving by outside could hear him..
author: Javier C.

description: Came here for dinner on a Friday night.  The deviled eggs were great, as was the market salad (kale, blue cheese).  We were a little disappointed in the the pappardelle with pork cheeks.  The addition of mushrooms seemed somehow off, in terms of texture.  They were rubbery and seemed superfluous.  The portions were very generous of everything-- two diners split the salad and could have split the pappardelle.  This is a very new spot.  I might try it again when they've worked out some of the kinks.  The service was fine-- our server was very dude about everything.
author: Heather G.

description: Visited for a birthday dinner. Drinks and food were delicious and the ambiance was great. The food came out super fast and drinks were strong. I dropped off a cake before dinner and the hostess said she would let the waiter know about the cake. After dinner the waiter asked if we wanted dessert and I had to tell him about the cake. The waiter also misplaced one of the signed dinner receipts but he eventually found it somewhere in the back. Definitely will be back!
author: Elisa T.

description: Three of us had dinner last night at Myriad Gastro Pub, after a friend recommended it.  From the moment we arrived, we were warmly greeted by Wesley one of their Managers and escorted to the dining room situated on the right side of the restaurant.  Our server Paul was knowledgable, made wonderful recommendations on the menu (& described them beautifully), professional and charming... Since we had heard about their Cocktail Program, we started with the Forbidden Lowball, Cubano & Canela y Cereja... All wonderful... Then we reviewed the wine list which was approachable, offered a lovely variety of wines from around the world and California of course, and well priced....We enjoyed the Deviled Eggs with Salsa Verde, the Farm Toast (fromage blanc, sage-roasted plums, toasted pistachios), followed by the Jersey Wedge, not your typical wedge, much more interesting with pickled onions, bacon, dry jack cheese & a delicious smokey thousand island dressing; the Crispy Fried Chicken Sammies (sliders with an amazing slaw & pickled vegetables); Bacalalitos (salt cod fritters with lemon aioli & crispy capers) and the BEST was the Spiced Shrimp, creamy grits (omg, the grits!!!!) & albarino-butter sauce.  The food was inventive, paced properly & sooooooo good!  Later in the evening, the Chef Tricia Tracey came over to ask us how our meal was & to thank us for coming in.  WHO does that?  A Chef with no attitude, coming over to the table to thank us for dining with them!!!  We will definitely be back.  It's our new favorite 'go to' spot!
author: Tracey R.

description: Excellent !!! Had my 50th Birthday Dinner Party  there it was amazing . The food was great , Patrick our Server was excellent !!!
author: allison h.

description: My wife and I made a reservation for Myriad based on Yelp reviews.  We were skeptical but decided to take a chance given the number of great restaurants opening up in the mission.  There was a good chance this one might be one of the good ones.  We were pleasantly surprised by the friendly and attentive staff that served us with their knowledge of the dishes and their patience in letting us figure out the menu.  They had a nice selection of savory small plates (bone marrow, farmers toast, and shrimp and grits), of which all were excellent.  We decided to split the halibut as an entree given we were feeling a little full from small plates.  The halibut turned out to be a delicious combination of light, buttery halibut, clams,  and perfectly sautéed pork belly, corn, and dried sweet tomatoes in a tarragon clam broth.   We were quite impressed with all the dishes and felt completely satiated. I had a nice glass of Malbec/Syrah and my wife had a glass of champagne which we started the meal with and ended up complimenting everything nicely.  I can definitely recommend.  There is a bar and the drinks look great.  I will definitely return for happy hour and more of the small plates.
author: Abe J.

description: Very good.  Found on a San Fran search. Food was really good.  Deviled eggs yummy.  Day 1 of 12 days of Christmas was a Columbia dish of pork that was really good    Alcohol is beer And wine. But the drinks they make out of the wine were unbelievable.  Must go place
author: Robin G.

description: I was very impressed with the service, food and drinks at Myriad. Had the mission statement cocktail which was pretty damn delicious (very grapefruity). The hash was very tasty and a great portion size. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave great recommendations. Wasn't overly crowded and we didn't feel rushed. Highly recommend if you're looking for a brunch place that actually takes reservations!
author: Kelly C.

description: Flavors flavors flavors - - all come together beautifully in each dish.  We split several smaller dishes.  The farm toast was out of this world goodness with yummy warm goat cheese.  And the plum salad special was lick the plate good!  Check out this new place...servers and owner are as great as the food too!!
author: Emma N.

description: Really loved this place! We went for brunch this weekend and enjoyed all of our dishes - the goat cheese/chive biscuits, the 5 spice challah french toast, the lamb sandwich and the coffee too. We had great service too. I thought the food had a nice mix of flavors - interesting, but not overkill or trying too hard to make something "distinct." We'll definitely be back for dinner sometime.
author: Felicia B.

description: I enjoyed a glass of Cremant with some chips to start and continued with the Papadelle and a glass of a California Pinot. The Cremant was the high point. Will try the burger next time.
author: Derp D.

description: Delicious, awesome new place! Fun menu and great service. Come before it gets too hip and busy like all the other mission restaurants!
author: Rebe B.

description: Went here for dinner tonight and was very happy. Ordered a nice and reasonably priced bottle of Rose with some deviled eggs and a panzanella salad (a special for the day). Then we shared the pickled vegetables, the roast lamb sandwich and the MGP steak fries. Everything, particularly the sandwich, was great. For dessert we picked one of the starters -- roasted peaches with goat cheese, which was an excellent end to the meal. All in all, we were very satisfied with our meal. Hope MGP is a success.
author: Keith S.

description: We went for an early dinner here the other day and loved it. I started with a chai based cocktail that I ordered strictly because I was scared of a chai based cocktail. My fears were unfounded; that drink was fantastic. We got deviled eggs and they made me oh so bitter. I had been going through life secure that I made the best deviled eggs; once again I was proved wrong. We then went on to have the Jersey wedge salad because my wife is under the misguided belief that you must always order a salad. Good thing she did; that roughage was damn tasty. We also got an order of shrimp and grits; then the record scratched to a halt. If you eat at Myriad and aren't allergic to shellfish you must order this. If you eat at Myriad and are allergic to shellfish order a side of grits. Holey moly. I got the halibut and clams and loved it. My wife got the hanger steak and said it was cooked and seasoned perfectly. The stone fruit and berry crisp was a great way to end the meal. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The Chef came by our table and chatted us up. Maybe I'm attention starved, but I love it when they do that. She seemed to actually enjoy the interaction unlike some times when it seems like the chef would rather eat tinfoil than talk to their tables. *** All you "people who hate children in public places even though you were one time a child yourself you self-absorbed, entitled, way too serious, goon" stop reading now. To the rest of you: Our 4  1/2 year old son was with us and loved it. He devoured his chicken sammie and steak fries and that alone would bring us back. When the Chef came to our table she goofed around with the boy and didn't at all make us feel like we were insane for thinking our child should sit and eat at a restaurant that didn't provide a kids meal and a menu you can color on. Thanks Myriad, we will be back for brunch soon.
author: Leland X.

description: Delicious! Every bite.  I'm usually the one who gets told about new, great restaurants.  Love to return the favor by letting you know about this incredible find.  Enjoy!
author: Rebecca L.
